questions.question_text: Following a merger and acquisition deal, an organization wants to integrate all customers into a single customer relationship management (CRM) system. Which of the following is the IT privacy practitioner’s MOST appropriate response?

choices.D: If the database benefits the customers, it can be done without additional consent.
choices.A: Personal data processing must adhere to the organization's privacy policy.
choices.C: The existing data privacy practices should be revised to account for the new database.
choices.B: The organization may proceed as customer consent has already been obtained.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
ensuring both compliance and customer trust during the integration process

questions.question_text: A recently issued privacy regulation requires that customer data be deleted within a certain timeframe upon customer request. What is an organization’s MOST important consideration related to compliance with this regulation?

choices.C: Knowing the retention schedule for customer information
choices.D: Knowing the storage location of customer information
choices.B: Classification policies related to customer information

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
it is important consideration for compliance with regulations requiring timely deletion of customer data

C. Knowing the retention schedule for customer information: Understanding the retention schedule is crucial because it outlines how long customer data is kept before it can be deleted. If an organization has a clear retention schedule that aligns with the new regulation, it can ensure that data is deleted within the required timeframe when customers request it. This knowledge is essential for compliance and for maintaining trust with customers.
